title: Kristen Bell, 39, flashes rock hard abs as she says she thought she'd never get them back after kids
text:
She came to peace with the fact that her abs would never return following the birth of her daughters, Lincoln, six, and Delta, four.

However, Kristen Bell even proved herself wrong, gracing the cover of November's Women's Health issue with her incredible abs on show.

The 39-year-old revealed she had found a new workout studio a year ago and her toned abs were 'a perk.'

Fit, toned and strong! Kristen Bell showcased her incredible rock hard abs on Wednesday when she graced the cover of Women's Health November issue

'I wasn’t trying to lose weight, but I was curvier and I was like, "Oh, great. This is the new me,"' she said after giving birth to her daughters.

'My children obliterated my abdominal wall. Good Night. That's a wrap. It's never going to come back. What do you need it for? You're married. SPANX exist. I had a fine abdomen when I was in my twenties, and now I don't.'

But then Kristen found Studio Metamorphosis in Pasadena, California, a year ago - a studio that mixes cardio, circuit training, Pilates, and CrossFit into grueling classes.

Body changes: 'I wasn’t trying to lose weight, but I was curvier and I was like, "Oh, great. This is the new me,"' she said after giving birth to her daughters

Throwback: Kristen revealed she thought she'd never get her abs back from when she was in her 20s (pictured with Russell Brand in Forgetting Sarah Marshall in 2008 when she was 28)

Loves it: 'I'm not in love with working out and I've never really found a class that I love like this. Something about this class gets me'

Kristen told the publication that she goes to the class usually three times a week, despite it being 30 minutes away, without traffic, from her Los Feliz home.

'I'm not in love with working out and I've never really found a class that I love like this. Something about this class gets me,' she said.

'I started doing this, and I was like, "I’m still roughly the same size but now it’s just all muscle" ... I feel so much stronger, and it's a physical feeling, but it's also a mental feeling. It's about the muscle value in my body.'

Kristen went on to say that she's never felt 'physically strong' until now since going to the classes.

Motivated: Kristen told the publication that she goes to the class usually three times a week, despite it being 30 minutes away, without traffic, from her Los Feliz home

Balance: 'I have to eat carbs because I have to memorize 11 pages of dialogue, and I can’t do that eating spinach and chicken,' she joked

As for her diet, the star revealed she was vegetarian and still enjoyed her dose of carbs.

'I have to eat carbs because I have to memorize 11 pages of dialogue, and I can’t do that eating spinach and chicken,' she joked.

A fan of au gratin potatoes she said she was never restrictive but enjoyed a moderate portion size.

One year on: 'I started doing this, and I was like, "I’m still roughly the same size but now it’s just all muscle" ... I feel so much stronger, and it's a physical feeling, but it's also a mental feeling. It's about the muscle value in my body' (L: Emmys 2018, R: Emmys 2019)

Kristen spoke about her dietary choices back in 2017 to the LA Times, explaining why she stopped being vegan.

'I was vegan and am now vegetarian. I’m all about eating clean and ethically, but I also believe that it’s important to listen to your body,' she said at the time.

'Some people’s bodies tell them to eat meat. There’s a better way to do it because factory farming is a nightmare. I give my children meat; the chicken they get has been raised in, basically, a spa. They get all but manicures.'
